title.narrative: OP1-NATIONAL CAPACITY FOR Maternal, Neonatal, and Child Health (MNCH)

description.narrative: OUTPUT 1 (OP1). Strengthened organizational & systemic capacity in health sector to deliver immunization & other high-impact child survival interventions for hard-to-reach children and their families as part of integrated Maternal, Neonatal, and Child Health (MNCH) services, which contributes to Child Health, Health And Emergencies, Health Systems Strengthening, Hiv Prevention, Immunization, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, the programme will achieve an enhanced policy environment, increased coverage of quality services (MNCH, Nutrition, HIV), and improved practices by individuals, families and communities, with particular emphasis on the most remote and vulnerable populations, resulting in healthier children and mothers.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: OUTPUT 1 (OP1). Strengthened organizational & systemic capacity in health sector to deliver immunization & other high-impact childsurvival interventions for hard-to-reach children and their families as part of integrated MNCH services

description.narrative: As of December 2016, 9 of 10 annual targets under Output 1 were met or on track. Only one of the 10 was constrained due to technological issues and limited resources. UNJP on MNCH approved for 2017-2020. | Status:Met | As-of Date:15/01/2017

title.narrative: Months with stockout of measles vaccine at the national level (Target: 0 month)

actual.value: 2016:0(Vaccines procured on time and no stock out reported

title.narrative: Improved organizational and systemic capacities for integrated health outreach (Points: 1) Responsibilities for planning, budgeting, implementation and monitoring of integrated health outreach are clarified and formally assigned to the relevant MoH departments at the national and subnational level 2) Outreach costing/budget norms made available for planning, budgeting and resource mobilization purposes 3) Systems and tools to monitor normative and implementation status of the outreach system dev

actual.value: 2016:3/3 Points (1) DHHP launched the process of harmonizing the Integrated Health Outreach guidance. (2) Outreach costing estimated using different budget norms – input-based and performance based pay – and used for costing of RMNCH and Nutrition Strategies and Plans of Action, as well as for 2015 reso

title.narrative: Improved individual, organizational and systemic capacities for forecasting, planning, budgeting and distribution of essential child survival commodities, including vaccines, micronutrients, deworming tablets (Points: 1) No stock out of vaccines at the central level, 2) Roles and responsibilities for forecasting, budgeting, procurement, distribution and monitoring of child survival commodities - vaccines, Vitamin A, deworming, iron folic acid, RUTF - clarified and formally assigned to relevant M

actual.value: 2016:4/4 points (1) There was no stock out of vaccines at the central level. (2) National Nutrition Center assigns nutrition supply focal point (3) Financial sustainability of immunization programme discussed with the Government. Medium term costing of vaccines and logistics for the year 2014-2020 devel

title.narrative: Improved availability, quality and use of disaggregated data and analysis for MNCH policy development, programming, monitoring and evaluation, including reporting in line with the international standards (Points: 1) At least quarterly analysis of EPI coverage by provinces and districts produced and disseminated to all the relevant stakeholder 2) Real time cold chain and vaccine monitoring system expanded and increasingly used for program action 3) At least 1 documented evidence per year on the r

baseline.value: Inadequate quality, completeness, timeliness and use of MNCH data for key planning and review events by health policy and decision makers at the national and subnational level.

actual.value: 2016:4/4 (1) EPI routine and SIAs data analyzed on quarterly/round basis and used for review and planning purposes.
